intro: Chaetanthera schroederi, commonly known as the Schröder's chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and often have a distinctive, fragrant scent. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
